metadata.title: CVE-2016-10124 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Linux Containers (LXC) before 2016-02-22. Whenexecuting a program via lxc-attach, the nonpriv session can escape to theparent session by using the TIOCSTI ioctl to push characters into theterminal's input buffer, allowing an attacker to escape the container.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblxc1 - 1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1
lxc - 1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1
lxc-templates - 1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1
lxc-tests - 1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1
python3-lxc - 1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lxc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.10-0ubuntu1.1').
